title: How has the proportion of outpatients warned about medication side effects to watch for changed?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of outpatients who reported not being warned about potential medication side effects has decreased from 39% in 2003 to 36% in 2011. However, 57% of outpatients reported not being completely warned about medication side effects to watch out for in 2011. In general the proportion of patients being completely warned about medication side effects to watch for is higher in outpatient departments than inpatients.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Outpatient Services
